籤詩版本二:
When the long rain in spring finally clears up
The Jade Rabbit and the Golden Crow gradually become brighter
Old things fade away and new things come into being
Take a look at Yitiaoyulongmen
詩意: This hexagram is a symbol of long rain and early light. Everything goes as planned.
解曰: Protected by gods and Buddhas. There is no danger of disaster. May the journey be peaceful. Return with honor in the end.
籤詩故事一:
◇ Jiang Taigong meets King Wen
Zhou Dynasty. Jiang Shang, courtesy name Ziya. Ji people (from Xuzhou in the East China Sea). The Taoist name is Fei Xiong, and his ancestors were sealed in Lu (place name), so he is also called Lu Wang.
To avoid the troubled times of King Zhou of Shang Dynasty, he lived by the water of the East China Sea and fished in the Weishui River. The fishhook is straight. His intention is not to fish, but to be a virtuous prime minister.
King Wen of Zhou heard that he was wise and hired him as his teacher (prime minister). (He was eighty years old at the time) Later, King Wu of Zhou attacked King Zhou, destroyed the Shang Dynasty, and established the Zhou Dynasty. King Wu called him Shangfu. His son Ding Gong was granted the title of Marquis of Qi.
(The focus of this story: Jiang Taigong, who had been waiting to fish on the Weishui River for a long time, finally got out of trouble and was reused by King Wen.)
聖意:
The house is Zhongping.
Pray for yourself.
Seeking wealth, not found.
Transaction Waiting for time.
Marriage at will.
Liujia Female.
Pedestrians block.
Tian Silkworm: Resistance.


Six animals hinder.
It’s too late to find someone.
Public litigation and.
Migration is lucky.
Lost things are seen.
Disease 禳星.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
